column3: This is missing additional test-cases currently!\n

I tried to test this but my payment request with a overflow amount was blocked earlier by `if(!BitcoinUnits::parse(BitcoinUnits::BTC, i->second, &rv.amount))` in `guiutil.cpp`.

Any ideas how to test this?

Misses unit test.
You are aware, that I'm currently in the way of adding a better test-coverage, as also written above :)?\nI'm not at the point where I thought about how to test this special case here...\n
Yes. I saw that you started writing more tests.\nI just added it into a comment so that we not forget about it.\n
Yeah that's good, also if you find an idea on how to test this case fell free to comment again :).\n

I guess I can create a payment request which contains an amount, which (when added together) will trigger the new code in here, because if overflows. But for this I need my other related pulls getting merged, as there are currently too many open ones related to payment requests ^^.\n
@Diapolo yes. Understand the step-by-step thing. I tried with a manipulates php script (from gavin). But overflown amounts was already detected in the bitcoin url parsing.\n

tested, reviewed, lldb stepped, ACK.

![bildschirmfoto 2015-01-30 um 09 35 50](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/178464/5973042/bc735db2-a863-11e4-9ee5-f61d814e82bc.png)

ACK on the checking code.

I'd say we can simplify the reported messages to the user. A user that gets a "invalid money range" message has no clue what to do (and neither do translatorws). Let's show a general "invalid payment request" message. More details (for developers) will be in the debug log.
@laanwj Message changed to what you suggested.\n
